description: From Middle English miscomfort, miscumfort, misconfort, equivalent to mis- +â€Ž comfort.

examples: I claim George, that the cause of all this miscomfort and suffrage that has befallen you and I and millions in this world, is due to this spirit of egoism that has possessed the hearts of those men who are at the head of affairs like this road and other kinds of industries that give employment.

verbs.description: miscomfort (third-person singular simple present miscomforts, present participle miscomforting, simple past and past participle miscomforted)
